Domain.Services.Creation

Class DOMDeserializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Domain.Services.Creation.DOMDeserializer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Deserializer

    public class DOMDeserializer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Deserializer
    A concrete class that implements the deserializer interface and is able to deserialize a Document Object Model (DOM) to domain specific components. This deserializer depends on the org.w3c.dom package. The DOMDeserializer recursively walks the DOM nodes to convert each valid node.

    • Method Detail

      • cacheSubjects

        private void cacheSubjects()
        One-time only computation of caching the subjects in the DOM slides. A treemap is used to store the index of a slide with a subject as the key and the subject itself as the value. The caching computation ensures that no subject is stored twice, if they follow each other in the list of DOM nodes.

      • convertToTOC

        public TOCSlide convertToTOC(int nodeIndex)
        Create a Table of Contents slide by caching the subjects, and finding the subject to be highlighted. A standard structure and styling is used, with a TOC header and a list of text items.
        Parameters:
        nodeIndex - The current index in the list of DOM nodes. Used to find the subject after the current node index, for highlighting purposes.
        Returns:
        an instance of TOCSlide

      • convertToSlide

        public Slide convertToSlide(int nodeIndex)
        Create a Slide that can either be a RegularSlide or a TOCSlide. Depending on the type attribute of the current node being of type "toc", creation functionality is delegated to convertToTOC(int nodeIndex) Otherwise, a regular slide is created by converting each of its DOM children, and parsing the attributes of the slide DOM element to styling elements.
        Specified by:
        convertToSlide in interface Deserializer
        Parameters:
        nodeIndex - The current index in the list of DOM nodes.
        Returns:
        Slide that can either be a RegularSlide or a TOCSlide

        Specified by:
        parseTitle in interface Deserializer
        Returns:
        the content of the title tag of the DOM as a String

        Specified by:
        getSlidesLength in interface Deserializer
        Returns:

      • convertToItem

        private SlideShowComponent convertToItem(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
        Switches over the DOM element tags and delegates creation functionality to appropriate methods. The tags are either "text", "list", "image", or "table".
        Parameters:
        node - The org.w3c.dom.Node object to match
        Returns:
        an instance of a SlideShowComponent.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - thrown when node is not one of the specified tag types, i.e., unreachable in the normal case.

      • convertToTextItem

        private TextItem convertToTextItem(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
        Create a text item. the assumption is made that the node parameter is of type "text", because this method is called from convertToItem(Node). Therefore, no assertion is made. Every possible style is attempted to parse and append to the TextItem.
        Parameters:
        node - The org.w3c.dom.Node object to parse
        Returns:
        an instance of a TextItem.

      • convertToRGB

        private int[] convertToRGB(java.lang.String colorString)
        Convert a String of structure "RED, GREEN, BLUE" to an integer array of int[] { RED, GREEN, BLUE }, where RED, GREEN, and BLUE are parsed to integers.
        Parameters:
        colorString - A valid string of the form "RED, GREEN, BLUE" where RED, GREEN, and BLUE are numeric string literals.
        Returns:
        an Integer array of length 3 with the string parsed into 3 color components.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - thrown when either of the color components is not able to be parsed to an Integer.

      • convertToImageItem

        private ImageItem convertToImageItem(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
        Create an image item. the assumption is made that the node parameter is of type "image", because this method is called from convertToItem(Node). Therefore, no assertion is made. the width and height attributes of the image DOM node are parsed to integers.
        Parameters:
        node - The org.w3c.dom.Node object to parse
        Returns:
        an instance of a ImageItem.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - thrown when the width of height are not able to be parsed to Integers.

      • convertToTable

        private Table convertToTable(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
        Create a Table composite. the assumption is made that the node parameter is of type "table", because this method is called from convertToItem(Node). Therefore, no assertion is made. the rows and cols attributes of the table DOM node are parsed to integers.
        Parameters:
        node - The org.w3c.dom.Node object to parse
        Returns:
        an instance of a Table.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - thrown when the rows of cols are not able to be parsed to Integers.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - thrown when either rows or cols don't match the size of the table elements.

      • convertToList

        private List convertToList(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
        Create a List composite. the assumption is made that the node parameter is of type "list", because this method is called from convertToItem(Node). Therefore, no assertion is made. Every possible style is attempted to parse and append to the List. Thereafter, the child elements of the node are iterated through and converted.
        Parameters:
        node - The org.w3c.dom.Node object to parse
        Returns:
        an instance of a List.
